content: Hey, am I right that https://zulip-archive.rust-lang.org/ hasn’t updated since October 11th?
oh gah
it's on gha cronjob these days and those timeout
goes to show: I might its only customer. :)
rekicked it, should run for another 60 days
(or at least, only customer who is also on zulip itself…)
@simulacrum uh why does it go to sleep?
it's the standard 60 day "no activity" timeout
afaik there's no way to fix that?
can we switch the code to use a deploy key to push changes instead of the PAT?
that way github doesn't really know it's from GHA
hm, does that actually help?
I thought it had to be activity on the main branch or something
I mean, worst case scenario a scheduled job every 50 days pushing an empty commit to main?

To prevent unnecessary workflow runs, scheduled workflows may be disabled automatically. When a public repository is forked, scheduled workflows are disabled by default. In a public repository, scheduled workflows are automatically disabled when no repository activity has occurred in 60 days.
I'd personally rather we move to e.g. aws codebuild for jobs like this if we have to start implementing workarounds
that also works

pnkfelix said:

goes to show: I might its only customer. :)

nah I also noticed but didn't have time to report a bug
I find it helpful for perma-links, mobile zulip makes it unnecessarily difficult to share links
and the web interface is slow on mobile
